document_data.name: Pigeon
document_data.mainbody: '''Pigeons''', also known as '''rock doves'''{{Cite web/theedverse/2018-11-17 - Wildlife of Waterdeep}} or '''blusterbirds''' in some parts of the [[Heartlands]], were a mundane species of bird found in the Realms.{{Cite dragon/277/The New Adventures of Volo: Dragonwing Stew|93}}
document_data.Description: The colorations of pigeons ranged from cream, brownish-pink, fawn, and white.<ref><ref>

Habitats.Beyond Faerûn:
* Pigeons could be found in the [[Hordelands]], being quite prominent around an oasis known as [[Pigeon Rock Oasis|Pigeon Rock]]. It was considered an [[evil]] act and bad luck to kill the pigeons of that oasis.
* In [[Kara-Tur]], pigeons could be found in [[Shou Lung]] and its splinter state [[T'u Lung]].<ref>
* Pigeons could be found in much of the land of [[Zakhara]], such as the city of [[Huzuz]].<ref> The common variety of pigeon was often kept in gardens for decoration or purchased for the purpose of eating. In the bazaars of Zakharan, the price of a common pigeon varied from one to two [[copper piece]]s depending upon how good one was at haggling.
Habitats.Beyond the Prime Material: * Pigeons could be found in the planar city of [[Sigil]].

Species.Homing pigeon|Homing: Homing pigeons, otherwise known as messenger pigeons or carrier pigeons, were a domesticated species.
Species.Land-seeking: Another domesticated species of pigeon in the land of Zakhara that were owned by mariners. These pigeons were specially trained to head fly up into the air once released, then use their uncanny sense of geography to head for the nearest island or continent within {{SI|150|miles|long=yes}}. If they could not find land within that range, they would return to their ship. In the bazaars of Zakharan, the price of a land-seeking pigeon varied from around 45 to 95 [[gold piece]]s depending upon how good one was at haggling.
Species.Plumphaer: A species of pigeon that was native to [[south Faerûn]].{{Cite web/Elminster Speaks/Part 56: Khôltar, Part 7, Leaving the Farrgaunlar}}

document_data.Usage: In a number of cities in the Realms, pigeon meat was used by the destitute to make [[pigeon pie]]s. Alternatively, some used pigeon meat in savory [[tart]]s stuffed with gravy.<ref>{{Cite web/theedverse/2019-03-01 - Street Food in Cormyr and the Wider Realms}} And in Waterdeep, some used pigeon meat as filling for the street food known as [[tatha]].<ref>{{Cite web/theedverse/2021-11-12 - Old Naecza and the Tatha}}

Notable Owners.Classes: * Some urban [[ranger]]s had a pigeon as an [[animal companion]].<ref>
Notable Owners.Businesses:
* Many bakers in the [[Baldur's Gate/Lower City|Lower City]] of Baldur's Gate sold dusky rolls filled with pigeon meat.<ref>
* The [[the Last Place (inn)|Last Place]] inn kept its own domesticated pigeons, which they used to make pigeon pie.<ref>
Notable Owners.Organizations:
* The [[Everlasting]], the largest [[holy slayer]] organization in Zakhara, kept both the common and homing pigeons in an aviary atop the roof of the [[Tower of Martyrs]] in [[Sarahin]]. They utilized the common variety as a source of food.
* When guarding a building, members of the [[Watchful Order of Magists and Protectors]] kept a pigeon with them. Whenever they were released, these pigeons would fly back to the [[Tower of the Order]], signaling that backup was needed.<ref>
